contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Bridge at Kirkham.jpg|thumb|Bridge across the [[River Derwent, Yorkshire|Derwent]] at Kirkham]] '''Kirkham''' is a [[village]] in [[North Yorkshire]], [[England]], close to [[Malton, North Yorkshire|Malton]], situated in the [[Howardian Hills]] alongside the [[River Derwent, Yorkshire|River Derwent]], and is notable for the nearby ruins of [[Kirkham Priory]], an Augustinian establishment. Kirkham was served by [[Kirkham Abbey railway station]] on the [[York to Scarborough Line]] between 1845 and 1930.<ref>{{Butt-Stations}}</ref> [[John Oxley]] (1785-1828), an explorer of south east [[Australia]], was born here. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Kirkham, North Yorkshire}} *{{oscoor gbx|SE739659}} {{coord|54.08372|N|0.87184|W|region:GB_source:enwiki-osgb36(SE739659)|display=title}}<!-- Note: WGS84 lat/long, converted from OSGB36 grid ref --> [[Category:Villages in North Yorkshire]] {{ryedale-geo-stub}}
